intro: Acrotrema uniflorum var. petiolare, commonly known as the petioled acrotrema, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, elongated petiole that supports its small, clustered inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in temperate regions with cool climates. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces a distinctive, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
